setting.name: Boot Option Filter
setting.description: Specifies the drives from which booting can be carried out

setting.name: Launch PXE OpROM Policy
setting.description: Specifies which PXE option ROM is booted. For the PXE boot, both the normal (Legacy) PXE boot and a UEFI PXE boot are available.

setting.name: Flash Write
setting.description: Flash write access; DISABLED: Flash BIOS update is not possible; RESTRICTED: Windows will not provide capsule update package, BIOS update possible with FUJITSU tools; ENABLED: Windows capsule update and flash via FUJITSU tools is enabled.

setting.name: Internal Camera2
setting.description: Enable or disable the second internal camera or rear camera.

setting.name: Internal Camera and Mic
setting.description: Internal combined camera and microphone.

setting.name: USB3
setting.description: No description available for this setting.

setting.name: Show Setup Entry Key F2
setting.description: No description available for this setting.

setting.description: No description available for this setting.

setting.name: Low Power Soft Off
setting.description: No description available for this setting.

setting.name: Hibernate like Soft Off
setting.description: Enable Low Power Soft Off or 0-Watt PC Feature during hibernate.

setting.name: DASH Support
setting.description: This setting is used to activate or deactivate the DASH support.

setting.name: Keyboard Check
setting.description: Disables the keyboard not connected warning during the boot.

setting.name: PS2 Mouse Configuration
setting.description: No description available for this setting.

setting.name: Password Entry on Boot for HDD
setting.description: User must enter HDD Password(s) on Boot.

setting.name: Password Entry on Boot
setting.description: User must enter User or Setup Password on Boot.

setting.name: Power Failure Recovery
setting.description: Specifies the system behaviour after a restart caused by a power failure.

setting.name: ECC Memory Error Logging
setting.description: Specifies whether ECC memory errors will be recognized and entered in the SMBIOS event log.

setting.name: PCI Error Logging
setting.description: Specifies whether PCI errors will be entered in the SMBIOS event log.

setting.name: PCI PERR Generation
setting.description: Specifies whether PERR# (PCI parity errors) are created.

setting.name: PCI SERR Generation
setting.description: Specifies whether SERR# (PCI system errors) will be created.

setting.name: UMTS Device
setting.description: No description available for this setting.

setting.name: Secure Boot
setting.description: Enable or disable the Secure Boot option.

setting.name: Compatibility Support Module
setting.description: This option controls if CSM will be launched.

setting.name: Primary Display
setting.description: Selects which graphics controller to use as the primary boot device.

setting.name: Internal Graphics
setting.description: Enable/Disable IGD Multi-Monitor by Internal Graphics Device.

setting.name: Easy PC Protection
setting.description: Easy PC Protection bypasses the boot password if boot grant confirmation is provided via the local area network (LAN).

setting.name: Halt on POST errors
setting.description: Defines whether the system boot process is aborted and the system halted when an error is detected.

setting.name: Password Severity
setting.description: Standard - Password skip jumper can be used to clear a lost password. Strong - Password skip jumper inoperable. In case of a lost password, unlocking only possible via service. Stringent - Password skip jumper inoperable. In case of a lost password, the system is permanently unusable.

setting.name: Keyboard Layout
setting.description: BIOS Keyboard Layout.

setting.name: Power On Source
setting.description: Select whether Power-on sources are controlled by BIOS (also valid for ACPI operating systems) or by an ACPI operating system.

setting.name: AMT
setting.description: Enable/Disable Intel (R) Active Management Technology BIOS Extension.

setting.name: USB Provisioning of AMT
setting.description: Enable/Disable AMT USB Provisioning.

setting.name: Unconfigure AMT/ME
setting.description: Perform AMT/ME unconfigure without password operation.

setting.name: TPM Device Selection
setting.description: Select discrete TPM chip or Intel (R) Platform Trust Technology (inside processor).

setting.name: Intel(R) PTT
setting.description: Enable/Disable Intel (R) Platform Trust Technology (inside processor).

param.text: Enable only ports used during boot
Enable all except mass storage devices and HUBs

commandline.helptext: Changing the System Firmware version is only possible if ON or RESTRICTED. ON: Windows Update (WU) and FUJITSU tools can change/update the System firmware version RESTRICTED: only FUJITSU tools can change/update the System firmware version. Windows Update (WU) is blocked.
Enable or disable the second internal camera or rear camera.
When OFF, wake up on LAN is enabled only when AC adaptor is connected. WOL has to be ON to change this setting.

supportedSetting.descriptiontext: Hibernate to Low Power Soft Off or 0-Watt PC

commandline.helptext: Hibernate to Low Power Soft Off or 0-Watt PC .
Configure how to execute MEBx (Ctrl + P)
User must enter HDD Password(s) on Boot.
User must enter User or Setup Password on Boot.

supportedSetting.descriptiontext: System state after a power failure

commandline.helptext: Specifies the system behaviour after a restart caused by a power failure.
Specifies whether ECC memory errors will be recognised and entered in the SMBIOS event log.
Specifies whether PCI errors will be entered in the SMBIOS event log.
Specifies whether PERR# (PCI parity errors) are created.
Specifies whether SERR# (PCI system errors) will be created.
Specifies whether to enable or disable an onboard UMTS device.
This option controls if CSM will be launched. When enabled, Secure Boot will be disabled.
Selects which graphics controller to use as the primary boot device.
Enable/Disable IGD Multi-Monitor by Internal Graphics Device.
Easy PC Protection bypasses the boot password if boot grant confirmation is provided via the local area network (LAN).

Standard - Password skip jumper can be used to clear a lost password. Strong - Password skip jumper inoperable. In case of a lost password, unlocking only possible via service. Stringent - Password skip jumper inoperable. In case of a lost password, the system is permanently unusable.
Select whether Power-on sources are controlled by BIOS (also valid for ACPI operating systems) or by an ACPI operating system.
Defines whether the system boot process is aborted and the system halted when an error is detected.
Enable/Disable Intel (R) Active Management Technology BIOS Extension.
Perform AMT/ME unconfigure without password operation.
Select discrete TPM chip or Intel (R) Platform Trust Technology (inside Processor).
Enable/Disable Intel (R) Platform Trust Technology (inside processor).
